sanskrit_verse: नैकः सुप्यात्शून्यगेहे न श्रेयांसं प्रबोधयेत् । शून्यगृहे स्वप्यान् नोदक्ययाऽभिभाषेत यज्ञं गच्छेन्न चावृतः ॥ ४.५७॥
transliteration: naikaḥ supyāt śūnyagehe na śreyāṁsaṁ prabodhayet | śūnyagṛhe svapyān nodakyayā'bhibhāṣeta yajñaṁ gacchen na cāvṛtaḥ || 4.57||
sph_interpretive_translation: One should not sleep alone in an empty house; one should not awaken a person who sleeps well. One should not speak to a woman in a secluded place; one should not approach a sacrifice without being invited.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from contextual alignment with Dharma, not individual desire.
Causation arises through conscious choice within structured relational boundaries.
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of situational integrity thresholds.
Restoration logic operates by preventing disruption rather than correcting aftermath.
Consciousness alignment demands adherence to spatial-temporal dharmic configurations.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent_is_alone AND location_is_empty_house THEN action_sleep IS PROHIBITED.
IF person_is_sleeping_well THEN action_awaken IS PROHIBITED.
IF agent_is_male AND target_is_female AND context_is_secluded THEN communication_initiation IS PROHIBITED.
IF event_is_yajna AND invitation_status IS absent THEN participation_access IS DENIED.
